FY2021.Goal21819: Ensure effective post approval monitoring, Quality Assessment (QA) and Quality Improvement (QI).  Post approval monitoring is an examination of the research and study documents (approved protocols) to assure that human subjects, animals and that investigators and compliance committees are in compliance with applicable University and Federal regulations.  QA is evaluation of whether or not activities meet defined standards. (QI) is a process initiated to improve a practice or procedure and to institutionalize the practice. QA/QI activities comprise a critical component of the research protections programs.
FY2021.Activities21819: Education of the research community through in-person programming, web site development and dissemination of formal and informal guidance;; 	Data collection and analysis to identify the cause and determine remediation of identified performance gaps;; 	Development and implementation of corrective action plans in response to internal and external investigations and inspections.
FY2021.Metrics21819: QA/QI evaluations will be conducted quarterly.  Reports will be used to identify areas for communication, education, training, and process review and improvement.
FY2021.Goal31819: To foster positive and effective relationship between researchers and ORRC.  We would like for faculty, staff, and students to view ORRC administrators as helpful experts rather than antagonizers.  A campus environment that communicates and promotes ethics in research benefits all, protects the universitys reputation, and encourages excellence in research.
FY2021.Activities31819: Compliance is achieved by a successful collaboration across the campus by all of the community.    The most helpful to this will be having those at the Universitys highest ranks communicate widely and often the importance of ethics and compliance.  The tone at the top provides the biggest support to ensuring high levels of compliance.  If the University is committed to achieving excellence in research and scholarship, messaging must include the necessity of researchers maintaining of the highest standards of integrity and ethics.  They  must hear this from the President.; ; We will hope to work collaboratively with other campus offices (e.g., Enterprise Risk Management, etc.) on communication, education, and promotional activities designed to better message the importance of ethics and compliance and ensure that University researchers and their departments remain compliant with federal, state, and local regulations and university policies.
FY2021.Metrics31819: Creation of research ethics materials to contribute to broader campus efforts to communicate the importance of ethics and compliance across the campus and on multiple platforms.
